label: 法相宗
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hossō (shū) (J.) 法相(宗) Ch. Fa-hsiang (tsung). The school of Chinese and Japanese Buddhism which studied the connection between the mind and production of constituent elements of reality called dharmas, and came to be referred to as the mind-only" school. In Japan, the Nara temples Yakushiji, Kōfukuji, and Gangōji were well-known centers for Hossō study."
